Module chessClockWork
Package time

Interface PlayerTimeDisplay

public interface PlayerTimeDisplay
Interface to be implemented by classes that want to display a player's time.
Since:
1.0;

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    setActive(boolean active)
    Sets the display as the active or the inactive one.
    void
    setClockTime(long time)
    Sets the general time that is to be displayed.
    void
    setMoveTime(long time)
    Sets the time remaining for making a move.
    void
    setOutOfTime()
    Signals that the time is up for this player.
    void
    setupForGame(boolean withMoveTimeLimit)
    Reset for a new game.
    void
    updateDisplay()
    Signals that the display can repaint itself now.
    void
    useWarningColor(boolean use)
    Turns the short-on-time warning on or off.

  • Method Details

    • setClockTime

      void setClockTime(long time)
      Sets the general time that is to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      time - Time to be displayed, in nanoseconds.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setMoveTime

      void setMoveTime(long time)
      Sets the time remaining for making a move. Remind that this time is fully optional.
      Parameters:
      time - Time to be displayed, in nanoseconds.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setActive

      void setActive(boolean active)
      Sets the display as the active or the inactive one.
      Parameters:
      active - Active?
      Since:
      1.0;

    • useWarningColor

      void useWarningColor(boolean use)
      Turns the short-on-time warning on or off.
      Parameters:
      use - Turn short-on-time warning on?
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setupForGame

      void setupForGame(boolean withMoveTimeLimit)
      Reset for a new game.
      Parameters:
      withMoveTimeLimit - Time limit imposed for each move?
      Since:
      1.0;

    • setOutOfTime

      void setOutOfTime()
      Signals that the time is up for this player. I'm sorry.
      Since:
      1.0

    • updateDisplay

      void updateDisplay()
      Signals that the display can repaint itself now. Sometimes, data may be transmitted not at a same time. In this case, it wouldn't make sense to repaint the display every time.
      Since:
      1.0;
